dcterms:creator: Joshua Glasser
Brian Lindauer
dcterms:description: The CERT dataset is a comprehensive dataset for insider threat detection, containing 48 malicious and 1,581,358 normal sessions recorded over 516 days. It includes various types of malicious sessions such as logon, email, HTTP, device, and file manipulations.
dcterms:title: CERT

dcterms:creator: Srijan Kumar
Francesca Spezzano
V.S. Subrahmanian
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of activity sessions of users who have edited the Wikipedia website, containing 5486 normal and 4627 malicious sessions. It is used to simulate open-set and imbalanced dataset scenarios.
dcterms:title: UMD-Wikipedia

dcterms:creator: Min Du
Feifei Li
Guineng Zheng
Vivek Srikumar
dcterms:description: The OpenStack dataset records the activity sessions of users who have used the OpenStack cloud services, containing 244,908 normal and 18,434 malicious sessions. It is used for evaluating anomaly detection methods.
dcterms:title: OpenStack
